title: Streamline testing and maintenance of tutorials

content.raw:
There are a bunch of tutorials on gazebosim.org/wiki/Tutorials that require manual maintenance, including:

* Pasting code into wiki pages.
* Manually running the tutorials to verify functionality.

These two aspects could be streamlined:

* Don't paste code, but rather include code by reference using `<include pre src="http://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/raw/branch/path/to/file" />` (we just installed a wiki extension to enable this).
* Create regression tests for each tutorial to verify that it builds, and optionally test its functionality.

We should still go through the tutorials periodically, but these steps should make it easier to find problems.

A benefit of this would be that the tutorials are more likely to work.

A drawback is that modifying tutorials would require modifying code on bitbucket (either through a pull request to the main gazebo repo or by linking to a fork / branch).
